metadata.template_skill: Student selects which fraction(s) from a set equal 1

telemetry_data.mastery_skill: Student can recognize that b/b = 1 (numerator equals denominator means one whole)

steps.dialogue: Look at these fractions. One of them equals exactly 1 whole.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Think about when you have all the parts - how many fourths make a whole?
Let's think about this together. A whole is made up of all the equal parts. When the numerator and denominator are the same number, you have all the parts - that equals 1 whole.

Let me walk you through this. We're looking for which fraction equals 1 whole. A fraction equals 1 when you have all the parts that make up the whole. The denominator tells us how many parts make a whole - in this case, 4 fourths make 1 whole. The numerator tells us how many parts we have. When we have 4 out of 4 fourths, we have all the parts, which equals exactly 1 whole. So 4/4 equals 1. That's how we know - when the numerator and denominator match, the fraction equals 1 whole.
